case_vignette: A 71-year-old man comes to the physician accompanied by his wife because of a 6-month history of worsening episodic upper abdominal pain and an 8-kg (17!6-lb) weight loss! The pain is dull, nonradiating, worse after eating, and occasionally associated with bloating and diarrhea! His symptoms have not improved despite 4 weeks of treatment with omeprazole! He attributes his weight loss to recently eating very small portions and avoiding fatty foods! He has hypertension and hypercholesterolemia! He underwent a coronary artery bypass graft operation for coronary artery disease 8 years ago! Current medications include lisinopril, metoprolol, atorvastatin, and aspirin! He has smoked a pack of cigarettes daily for 20 years and drinks 1–2 beers daily! His pulse is 79/min and blood pressure is 138/89 mm Hg! Examination shows a soft abdomen without tenderness to palpation or guarding!
question: Which  is most likely to confirm the diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Gastrointestinal System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing worsening episodic upper abdominal pain for the past 6 months, it becomes worse after I eat, and I also have occasional bloating and diarrhea.
Have you noticed any specific foods that worsen your symptoms or any triggers?
Yes, my symptoms worsen after eating fatty foods.
Do you have any other medical conditions or are you currently taking any medications?
Yes, I have hypertension and hypercholesterolemia, and I currently take lisinopril, metoprolol, atorvastatin, and aspirin.
Has there been any recent changes in the color of your stool or have you noticed any jaundice (yellowing of the skin or eyes)?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in the color of my stool or any jaundice.
Do you have any family history of gastrointestinal diseases or gallbladder issues?
I don't have any knowledge of a family history concerning gastrointestinal diseases or gallbladder issues.
Have you recently lost weight unintentionally or experienced any fever?
Yes, I have lost about 17.6 pounds unintentionally over the past 6 months.
Final Diagnosis: Biliary colic
